replies.body: Cass isn't currently a scheduled project due to us wrapping up the season and preparing for the next. This isn't to say someone can't get some ideas rolling on her, but we do have to be respectful of the current stuff planned. I think the good news for Cass is that I really think she doesn't need a ton of change to help out in most of the main areas where old Cass mains would be happiest.

Using her current state as a base she mostly just needs her damage rebalanced equally into both her poisons and Twin Fangs instead of everything loaded into Twin Fangs and for her passive bonuses to be changed (please get rid of that CDR -_- ).

I just want cass to be a melter of faces again instead of a chunky machinegunner. liandri's + rylais should be a very viable build on cass for when all inning her opponent's isn't the smartest/safest thing to do. But atm, her E is overloaded and her poisons don't feel good to use at all, let alone max first.

> I think the good news for Cass is that I really think she doesn't need a ton of change to help out in most of the main areas where old Cass mains would be happiest.

Please clarify. She has some really serious thematic and "feel" problems right now.

How does ending the season affect your work on champions in any way? Your latest patches introduced tons of drastic changes (especially on those 'Juggernauts') and you're saying you have nothing planned for Cass due to the season coming to an end? Do you have any idea how that sounds?

Cassiopeia was downright abandoned and left to rot by Stashu, since then no one felt obliged to do anything for her. She's been an extreme nich√©pick for a long time now after the neverending wave of nerfs she has received, right now she's almost as bad as she was when the rework hit her. **Her win- and pickrate are evidence enough of that - not even her dedicated playerbase can make her work anymore.**

By leaving Cass on her own you're hardly any better than the person who singlehandely destroyed this champion. She probably is the most unpopular midlaner in the game judging by the way you're setting your priorities. If this isn't a clear sign of favoritism, I don't know what. **She needs a proper rework this time, and that very soon.**

I'm tired of my main getting the short end of the stick constantly just because her name isn't Ahri, Fizz or Zed. **If all of her counterpicks are extremely popular champions, how on earth is she supposed to survive in the meta?** Can you explain this to me?

you are right mate .

it is a smurf account ? ^^

Yeah, I've created this account back then when people we're stuck with the old forums. There was no way for anyone from EUW to participate in the relevant part of the community (only NA boards had reds who actually posted in threads) so I had no other choice than to create a NA account. Don't expect me to play with this acc though, my ping is simply terrible over there.

Over the years I managed to build up something like a reputation which is why I'm sticking with this account for any discussion on the boards. It's also an additional layer of anonymity which is always nice to have.

Maybe bring up the AP ratios for Q and W, lower the ratio for E. Change the passive so that instead of being a ball of stats passive, it increases the duration of the poison DOT; adjust base cooldowns and ratios accordingly. The E reset feels really really nice right now, and I like the idea that hitting an enemy with twin fang increases your poison's damage. Anyways, just my two cents.
